text.content:
The first step to play is creating your player character (PC). Character creation involves making rules choices that define who your character is and what your character is good at, as well as creative choices about your character’s history and personality.

This chapter contains exact steps and options to create your character. If you are creating a character for the first time, it can be helpful to work with your game master (GM) to choose options that make a good play experience.

These are the steps needed to create your character.

Step 0. Gather Materials

@Embed[Compendium.black-flag.rules.JournalEntry.zHvTHITijHvb07FK.JournalEntryPage.h5VmgC4k0C7RSzhZ inline]

Step 1. Create a Character Concept

@Embed[Compendium.black-flag.rules.JournalEntry.zHvTHITijHvb07FK.JournalEntryPage.VngmNbDMIO4Bdabs inline]

Step 2. Choose a Class

@Embed[Compendium.black-flag.rules.JournalEntry.zHvTHITijHvb07FK.JournalEntryPage.MDQq8VY4xepiqXM3 inline]

Step 3. Determine Ability Scores

@Embed[Compendium.black-flag.rules.JournalEntry.zHvTHITijHvb07FK.JournalEntryPage.gn2VZtusu5gWWNIk inline]

Step 4. Choose a Lineage

@Embed[Compendium.black-flag.rules.JournalEntry.zHvTHITijHvb07FK.JournalEntryPage.mM2yTavu4qLJVPL7 inline]

Step 5. Choose a Heritage

@Embed[Compendium.black-flag.rules.JournalEntry.zHvTHITijHvb07FK.JournalEntryPage.78flh62vhvTJG3Xd inline]

Step 6. Choose a Background

@Embed[Compendium.black-flag.rules.JournalEntry.zHvTHITijHvb07FK.JournalEntryPage.MNeN6RvivQu25UaP inline]

Step 7. Fill in the Blanks

@Embed[Compendium.black-flag.rules.JournalEntry.zHvTHITijHvb07FK.JournalEntryPage.cT6scAV8HOgsMb9M inline]

Every adventurer has a character class that dictates the heroic features they have access to. It can be helpful to think of a character’s class like their job, with each type covering a different set of capabilities and responsibilities.

The Class Options at a Glance table gives an overview about the classes detailed in this section.

Elements of a Class

@Embed[Compendium.black-flag.rules.JournalEntry.zHvTHITijHvb07FK.JournalEntryPage.7z7vnntI21WyYFrI inline]

After Level 1

@Embed[Compendium.black-flag.rules.JournalEntry.zHvTHITijHvb07FK.JournalEntryPage.lZIBTSxtjVNxf79V inline]

description.additionalEquipment:
You start with the following equipment, in addition to the equipment granted by your background:

  • (a) a mace or (b) a warhammer (if proficient)

  • (a) scale mail, (b) leather armor, or (c) chain mail (if proficient)

  • (a) light crossbow and 20 bolts or (b) any simple weapon

  • (a) a priest’s pack or (b) an explorer’s pack

  • A shield and a holy symbol
description.subclassAdvancement:
Choose one domain related to your deity, such as Life or War (see Cleric Subclasses below). Your choice grants you domain spells and other features at 3rd level.

Domain Spells

Each subclass has a list of spells—its domain spells—that you gain access to as soon as you can cast spells of that ring (as shown in the Cleric Progression table). Once you gain a domain spell, you always have it prepared, and it doesn’t count against the number of spells you can prepare each day. Casting a domain spell, however, still uses up a spell slot as normal.

If you have a domain spell that doesn’t appear on the divine circle spell list, it is still a divine spell for you.
description.subclassSection: You have proved your devotion to your faith and your efforts are rewarded with a deeper connection to your god—granting access to the powers of a domain they preside over. Two are presented here: Life Domain and War Domain.

description.additionalEquipment:
You start with the following equipment, in addition to the equipment granted by your background:

  • (a) chain mail or (b) leather armor, longbow, and 20 arrows

  • (a) a martial weapon and a shield or (b) two martial weapons

  • (a) a light crossbow and 20 bolts or (b) two handaxes

  • (a) a dungeoneer’s pack or (b) an explorer’s pack
description.subclassSection: As you develop mastery, you gain new abilities that support your preferred combat tactics. The subclass you choose represents your specialized training in pursuit of ever- greater martial might.
description.subclassAdvancement: Your basic capabilities as a warrior have reached their peak. It is time to choose a discipline to focus your training. Choose a discipline from the options presented later in this section. Your discipline represents the unique techniques and maneuvers you employ in battle and gives you new features as you gain more levels in the fighter class.

description.additionalEquipment:
You start with the following equipment, in addition to the equipment granted by your background:

  • (a) a rapier or (b) a shortsword

  • (a) a shortbow and quiver of 20 arrows or (b) a shortsword

  • (a) a burglar’s pack, (b) a dungeoneer’s pack, or (c) an explorer’s pack

  • Leather armor, two daggers, and thieves’ tools
description.subclassAdvancement: To distinguish yourself from common scoundrels and knaves, you cultivate a more specialized set of skills. Choose a subclass from the options presented later in this section, such as Thief or Enforcer. Your specialty grants you features at 3rd level and again at higher levels.
description.subclassSection: Not all rogues are criminals, but the long history of rogues working on the wrong side of the law carries forward in discussion of roguish specialties. A rogue’s subclass represents the brand of skullduggery they bring to the table—typically in the context of a criminal operation.

description.additionalEquipment:
You start with the following equipment, in addition to the equipment granted by your background:

  • (a) a quarterstaff or (b) a dagger

  • (a) a component pouch or (b) an arcane focus

  • (a) a scholar’s pack or (b) an explorer’s pack

  • A spellbook
description.subclassAdvancement: When you reach 3rd level, choose a subclass, representing the specialized way you practice magic. Examples include the Battle Mage or Cantrip Adept, detailed at the end of the wizard class description.
description.subclassSection:
As long as there has been magic, there have been creatures determined to research, quantify, and define it. Most of them are wizards.

Centuries of magical study have led to various arcane traditions that encompass different methods of thinking about—and practicing—spellcasting. The subclass you choose represents the lens through which you focus your ongoing study of the arcane.

text.content:
Lineage represents the blood ties and hereditary traits of a creature. It’s what you’re born to, no matter where you were born. Lineages include beastkin, dwarves, elves, and humans.

Elements of a Lineage

@Embed[Compendium.black-flag.rules.JournalEntry.zHvTHITijHvb07FK.JournalEntryPage.2aQCutBkNJQCkxAb inline]

Lineage Descriptions

These lineage options are available to adventurers.

Beastkin Lineage Traits

@Embed[Compendium.black-flag.lineages.Item.QEsG38SZx6CrIK4e inline]

Dwarf Lineage Traits

@Embed[Compendium.black-flag.lineages.Item.FDN9LQ9PuWO7qISX inline]

Elf Lineage Traits

@Embed[Compendium.black-flag.lineages.Item.MM7zjzxCO28oFVlv inline]

Human Lineage Traits

@Embed[Compendium.black-flag.lineages.Item.pppO9iaGj37Fq0e7 inline]

Heritage represents the upbringing and culture of a character. It’s what your parents, community values, or other formative authority figures taught you. Example heritages include cosmopolitan (city dwellers), grove (forest denizens), and stone (undermountain folk).

Heroic characters sometimes come from unexpected origins. Your character might have been raised among a typical community of their lineage or from a totally different life.

Elements of a Heritage

@Embed[Compendium.black-flag.rules.JournalEntry.zHvTHITijHvb07FK.JournalEntryPage.RKQeps99GA5J5PwW inline]

Heritage Options

This section contains descriptions of the heritage options available to adventurers. If you’re not sure or want a character that reflects common fantasy archetypes, choose a recommended heritage listed on the table below.

Common Heritages by Lineage
LineageRecommended Heritages
BeastkinSlayer, Wildlands
DwarfFireforge, Stone
ElfCloud, Grove
HumanCosmopolitan, Nomadic
Cloud Heritage

@Embed[Compendium.black-flag.heritages.Item.hns164WLxPQkBaGH inline]

@Embed[Compendium.black-flag.heritages.Item.E6nuFUq2RWnQKPnm inline]

Fireforge Heritage

@Embed[Compendium.black-flag.heritages.Item.ZBZlFGLiBtHmGkDM inline]

Grove Heritage

@Embed[Compendium.black-flag.heritages.Item.pdtr5iQRACvqhZaW inline]

Nomadic Heritage

@Embed[Compendium.black-flag.heritages.Item.GVvyWSemb9GD22fW inline]

Stone Heritage

@Embed[Compendium.black-flag.heritages.Item.DIwZtiOHNeacODwb inline]

Slayer Heritage

@Embed[Compendium.black-flag.heritages.Item.ECkN3p3yLEEagnfH inline]

Wildlands Heritage

@Embed[Compendium.black-flag.heritages.Item.Y4nmkyJMwj9m3jPK inline]

Background helps define your character’s personal history (also called backstory) before taking up the mantle of an adventurer. When choosing a background, consider how it plays into your character’s heritage and class. Did your life as a soldier naturally pave the way for you to become a fighter? Did a religious experience pull you away from a community that holds a different faith?

Your choice of background gives you access to additional proficiencies, talents, equipment, and other benefits like additional languages.

Elements of a Background

@Embed[Compendium.black-flag.rules.JournalEntry.zHvTHITijHvb07FK.JournalEntryPage.ZkJyfgaTtGLGQuMi inline]

Adherent

@Embed[Compendium.black-flag.backgrounds.Item.vFUkVZ2PlYwriNGD inline]

Outcast

@Embed[Compendium.black-flag.backgrounds.Item.1gdymP8TQpr3mmHi inline]

Scholar

@Embed[Compendium.black-flag.backgrounds.Item.9dRikRUkl51QM1pw inline]

Soldier

@Embed[Compendium.black-flag.backgrounds.Item.a0rlzqNtirxoHIDL inline]

Talents represent the specific ways an adventurer has improved over the course of their adventures. Talents are divided into three categories: magic talents, martial talents, and technical talents. Your class typically determines which talent lists you have access to. Talents are gained in two main ways:

  • When a character chooses their background during character creation, they select one talent from a list of options provided in the background.

  • When a character class grants an Improvement, they choose a talent from the list specified by their class features—assuming the character meets any necessary prerequisites.

Magic Talents

Most magic talents affect a character’s spellcasting abilities, but they also include features that strengthen the mind and defend against harmful magic effects.

Combat Casting

@Embed[Compendium.black-flag.talents.Item.r8ZTz5fXwJEdjv6E inline]

Elemental Savant

@Embed[Compendium.black-flag.talents.Item.d1q5Zr4IFrc6HjQL inline]

Mental Fortitude

@Embed[Compendium.black-flag.talents.Item.3zFHMbUlVoYARCtM inline]

Mental Prowess

@Embed[Compendium.black-flag.talents.Item.AT2XL1S3tEBF1l6y inline]

Ritualist

@Embed[Compendium.black-flag.talents.Item.XgPmZKWdA0WJ9BVl inline]

School Specialization

@Embed[Compendium.black-flag.talents.Item.nYc9jTRZrMMw8NoX inline]

Martial Talents

Martial talents affect a character’s combat abilities, including enhancements to overall fitness and the ability to wield weaponry.

Armored Combatant

@Embed[Compendium.black-flag.talents.Item.34ABBBo5NyxY3deE inline]

Artillerist

@Embed[Compendium.black-flag.talents.Item.UMfrzyJKVtHESLUi inline]

@Embed[Compendium.black-flag.talents.Item.bh77YhJPYJorKvXA inline]

Hand to Hand

@Embed[Compendium.black-flag.talents.Item.9cwctIErio7chTKz inline]

Physical Fortitude

@Embed[Compendium.black-flag.talents.Item.KrnY2wslIf2m1M0l inline]

Physical Prowess

@Embed[Compendium.black-flag.talents.Item.Kw9UpuUJjUM3v1Qr inline]

Ranged Weapon Mastery

@Embed[Compendium.black-flag.talents.Item.zZW1rBeOPAMYvqvS inline]

Two Weapon Mastery

@Embed[Compendium.black-flag.talents.Item.SR1jUz3xjkf16WRt inline]

Technical Talents

Technical talents affect a character’s noncombat abilities, granting utility-based improvements to social encounters, exploration, and object interactions.

Award

@Embed[Compendium.black-flag.talents.Item.KLyH1PNGPj8p9sM5 inline]

@Embed[Compendium.black-flag.talents.Item.a89OU77hOUv438yn inline]

@Embed[Compendium.black-flag.talents.Item.ObjD4NtWZolqK6hY inline]

Well-Rounded

@Embed[Compendium.black-flag.talents.Item.kDXSJDJSXFfvkh4n inline]

Every PC has a special resource called Luck that can be used to influence the result of any of your checks: ability check, attack roll, or save.

Gaining Luck Points

@Embed[Compendium.black-flag.rules.JournalEntry.zHvTHITijHvb07FK.JournalEntryPage.UpQzAwsH3QMHAJgq inline]
